snippet: The broken air-conditioning system in Game 1 of the N.B.A. finals was highly unusual, but it did not compare to the Fog Game during the Stanley Cup finals on May 20, 1975.
abstract: Surreal 1975 Stanley Cup finals between Buffalo Sabres and the Philadelphia Flyers is remembered for the intrusion of a bat and an eerie blinding fog that rose off the ice, causing play to stop repeatedly.
lead_paragraph: The broken air-conditioning system in Game 1 of the N.B.A. finals was highly unusual, but it did not compare to the Fog Game during the Stanley Cup finals on May 20, 1975.

headline.seo: The Sabres and Flyers Played a Low-Visibility Game in 1975
headline.main: Neither Player Nor Bat Was Ready for the Fog
headline.print_headline: Neither Player Nor Bat Was Ready for the Fog
